scenario: You are in Professor Kim's sociology class. Your midterm was graded from an old draft after a website upload mistake, and the score is much lower than expected.
goals: Explain what happened with the submission
Request permission to submit the final draft
Describe how the current grade affects your course standing

scenario: Your lab partner withdrew from your chemistry project one week before the final presentation, and your section has no clear replacement policy.
goals: Summarize the group change and timeline
Ask two specific questions about grading and replacement
Propose a workable plan for completing the project

scenario: You subscribe to a poetry magazine and submitted a poem through its website, but an error appeared after clicking Submit and you received no confirmation.
direction: Send an email to the editor.
goals: Mention your interest in the magazine
Describe the technical submission issue
Ask whether your poem was received

scenario: Your campus library moved one quiet-study floor to group-study use during exam month, and now late-evening quiet seats are rarely available.
goals: Describe the study problem you face
Ask what temporary quiet-space options exist
Suggest one realistic scheduling or zoning adjustment

scenario: You accepted a volunteer role at a local clinic through the university portal, but your logged hours are missing and your scholarship requires verified service records.
goals: Explain the missing-hours issue clearly
Request clarification on verification steps and timeline
Suggest how to document your completed shifts

scenario: You were invited to interview for a part-time campus job, but the proposed interview time overlaps with a required speaking exam.
goals: State the scheduling conflict politely
Ask if an alternative interview slot is possible
Reconfirm your interest in the position

scenario: Your dorm Wi-Fi has frequent outages, and you have a timed online test next week that cannot be paused once started.
direction: Send a message to IT Help Desk.
goals: Report the connectivity pattern and urgency
Ask what fix is planned before your test date
Request a temporary backup access option

scenario: After a guest lecture by a marine biologist, you want to shift your senior thesis topic and need quick guidance before proposal deadlines.
goals: Thank the speaker and reference one concrete idea
Connect that idea to your thesis direction
Ask for one or two recommended readings

scenario: You were approved for study-abroad housing, but the assignment was changed to a location that adds a long daily commute to your internship site.
goals: Explain the housing mismatch and constraints
Ask what reassignment options are available
Propose a practical alternative arrangement

scenario: You missed a quiz because of a same-day clinic visit, and your course policy allows makeups only with timely documentation.
goals: Explain the absence with concise context
Ask what documentation format is required
Request a makeup plan that meets policy

scenario: Your student club's approved event budget was reduced after vendor prices increased, putting a community workshop at risk of cancellation.
goals: Summarize the budget gap and its impact
Ask whether emergency funding channels exist
Suggest a scaled plan that still meets event goals

scenario: Your official transcript request has not been processed, and your graduate application portal shows a final deadline in four days.
goals: State the processing issue and deadline pressure
Ask for status and fastest available option
Request temporary proof that a transcript request is in progress
